BP3

BP3 is

\frac{\partial C}{\partial b^l_j} = \delta^l_j

By chain rule

\frac{\partial C}{\partial b^l_j} = \frac{\partial z_j}{\partial b^l_j} \frac{\partial C}{\partial z_j}

Definition of z_j is

z_j = b_j + w_j a

where w_j is weight matix's jth row. We can easily see that

\frac{\partial z_j}{\partial b^l_j} = 1 \\ \rightarrow \frac{\partial C}{\partial b^l_j} = \frac{\partial C}{\partial z_j} = \delta^l_j

BP4

BP4 is

\frac{\partial C}{\partial w^l_{jk}} = a^{l-1}_k \delta^l_j

By chain rule

\frac{\partial C}{\partial ^l_j} = \frac{\partial z_j}{\partial w^jk} \frac{\partial C}{\partial z_j}

Definition of $`z_j'$ is

\begin{aligned} z_j &= b_j + w_j \cdot a \\ &= b_j + \sum w_{jk} a_k \end{aligned}

Derivative of z_j in terms of w_{jk} is easily

\begin{aligned} &\frac{\partial z_j}{\partial w^jk} = a_k \\ &\rightarrow \frac{\partial z_j}{\partial w^jk} \frac{\partial C}{\partial z_j} \\ &= a_k \delta^l_j \end{aligned}
